    Here is headline

    Use Jekyll to create static personal blog

    Here is post description
    18 Apr 2016 in Personal

    "If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart." Buddha

    I have been away from the blog for quite a while. Recently, I encountered a wonderfull static website generating tool-Jekyll. After searching online, I decided to use hmfaysal-omega-theme and began to build my new blog. Here is my old blog building from Django+MongoDB threelifestone. If the link not work, I must have close it in the future.

    Simple examples

    • Plain code style
    • Code highlighting
    • Lists
      • Item list
      • Number list
    • Insert image
    • Latex support
    • Split columns

    Plain code style

    Below shows a piece of code, just use four space before each line. It is very similar to the stack overflow code style.

    It has four spaces before
 It has five spaces before
  It has six spaces before

    Code highlighting

    Jekyll uses Liquid templating language. It supports many language highlights. Here is a python example:

    Lists

    Item list

    One example:

    • Drink more water
    • Do practice everyday
    • Have fun

    Another example:

    • Practice is the key
    • Reflection
      • retrospect
      • always think why
    • Whatever

    Number list

    1. item 1
    2. item 2

    Insert image

    Now, comes to image:

    Latex support

    Schrodinger equation1

    Maxwellâ€™s Equations


    Split columns

    This is left column. If want to show three columns instead of two, just repeat div class col-md-x three times.

    This is the right column. Notice that we can specify col-md-x, where x is the number, but they add up should equal 12 in this site settings.


    Here you go.

    1. Schrodinger equation wiki ↩
